intro: Lepisanthes cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed piper, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Piperaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their aromatic properties. The plant is characterized by its slender, alternate leaves and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, black seeds.
